material.mattext: Setup an equation with N as unknown, and solve for N.
Here is the new probability distribution of X:

Note that we updated the probabilities of total loss and 50% damage by tripling them, and the probability of no fire has changed to 1-.006-.024=.97. The company wants to keep the same annual gain from the policy ($750), and question is what should be the new premium N that will satisfy this. In other words, we need to solve the following equation for N: 750=(N-100000)*.006+(N-50000)*.024+N*.97=N-600-1200=N-1800. And therefore, N=750+1800=2550 In order to account for the added risk that the insurance company is taking by continuing to insure the customer the premium changes from 1350 to 2550.
